title: Analytic subgroup theorem
summary: In mathematics, the analytic subgroup theorem is a significant result in modern transcendental number theory.  It may be seen as a generalisation of Baker's theorem on linear forms in logarithms. Gisbert WÃ¼stholz proved it in the 1980s.[1][2] It marked a breakthrough in the theory of transcendental numbers. Many longstanding open problems can be deduced as direct consequences.
